title: GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)
text:
GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)
GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)Posted Apr 25, 2024 9:02 UTC (Thu) by Karellen (subscriber, #67644)
In reply to:
[GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)](/Articles/971079/)by taladar
Parent article:
[GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)](/Articles/971008/)
If people can't access the "post a comment" UI for a repo, how are they going to upload a file associated with a comment to it?
(
Log into post comments)
GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)
Posted Apr 25, 2024 9:08 UTC (Thu) by NAR (subscriber, #1313)
[
[Link](/Articles/971082/)]
Exactly, how are they going to upload e.g. a screenshot for a comment? Which is really useful for GUIs...
GitHub comments used to distribute malware (BleepingComputer)
Posted Apr 25, 2024 10:00 UTC (Thu) by sidcha (subscriber, #153938)
[
[Link](/Articles/971085/)]
They (attacker) would just use another project that allows comments.
